title: My Dad Asked Me to Max Out My 401(K), But I Bought These COS, H&M, and Mango Items Instead (Sorry)
text: (Image credit: Mango)I can't be the only person whose father insists they max out their 401(k) every single time you speak with them. I swear it's the first thing he brings up during our weekly catch-ups. Usually, I'm happy to oblige, but after my morning new-arrivals scroll, I'm not convinced it's the best use of my finances—at least, not this month. Instead, I'd rather invest in my wardrobe, specifically with the 30 finds I just discovered at COS, Mango, and H&M. Sure, I might be a little bit less prepared for retirement in a decade, but I'll have a rich-looking wardrobe, and right now, that's priority number one.Ahead, discover the 10 pieces from each of the aforementioned retailers that look far more expensive than they are. None cost more than $250, and the only ones that reach that limit are cashmere aka the material most worth splurging on. Before they dare to sell out, scroll down to start picking out your favorites. Trust me. They'll be worth giving up this month's 401(k) allocation for, even if it means getting that disappointed dad look over FaceTime. H&M Tie-Belt Twill Jacket This belted jacket might cost $60, but everyone will estimate its value to be $600+. Chocolate-brown trousers? Say less. I'm honestly shocked that these haven't sold out yet. H&M Twill Jacket With Belt H&M Blue Light Eyeglasses No one has to know these aren't prescription. No, you don't need to spend hundreds of dollars to get a suede jacket that looks luxurious. H&M Twill Jacket With Collar H&M Knee-High Biker Boots These moto boots were calling my name, but I'm not sure my dad will accept this as an excuse. Mango MANGO Jacket With Mandarin Collar and Jewel Buttons The only word that comes to mind is wow. MANGO Matilda Medium-Rise Straight-Fit Jeans Mango's jeans are slept on far too often. MANGO Kitten Shoe With Round Toe These are so elegant. Count me as a fan. MANGO Contrasting Satin Dress The sheer layer makes this dress feel far more formal and rich than a standard slip. MANGO Oversized Parka With Zipper "Need" is a strong word, but it's the only one appropriate when this anorak is the subject in question. MANGO Short Knit Table Dress Of course, I need this drop-waist minidress to wear underneath the above anorak. MANGO Open-Toe Leather Shoes MANGO Chunky-Knit Sweater With Ribbed Trims I know, I know—I own a lot of sweaters, but this one is different than all of those. MANGO High Neck Midi Wool Coat Dress for the tax bracket you want to be in, starting with this seriously pricey-looking coat. MANGO Double-Handle Bowling Bag As if anyone needed an excuse to buy this east-west bowling bag, it just went on sale. COS COS Oversized Tailored Shirt I can just imagine wearing this pastel shirt with a bikini in Sicily. COS Square-Toe Leather Court Shoes My wallet hates to see a cute pair of in-stock court shoes coming. COS Cavatelli Phone Pouch in Leather This little red purse is too cute to not purchase. COS Column Straight-Leg Jeans I might not need another pair of straight-leg jeans, but I want them, and that's enough for me today. COS Fine Pure Cashmere Cardigan Great cashmere is never a bad investment. COS Molten Pendant Necklace World, meet the necklace set to make every one of my boring outfits chic. COS Boiled-Wool Midi Dress I'm in love with the neckline on this wool dress. COS Minimal Suede Trainers The red version of these already sold out. Don't let this gorgeous brown option follow suit. COS Pure Cashmere Sweater BRB, I'm busy buying cashmere. COS Boiled Merino Wool Pants To go with my new fancy cashmere sweater, naturally. Eliza Huber is a New York-based senior fashion editor who specializes in trend reporting, brand discovery, and the intersection of sports and fashion. She joined Who What Wear in 2021 after almost four years on the fashion team at Refinery29, the job she took after graduating with a marketing degree from the University of Iowa. She has since launched two monthly columns, Let's Get a Room and Ways to Wear; profiled the likes of Dakota Fanning, Diane Kruger, Katie Holmes, Gracie Abrams, and Sabrina Carpenter for WWW's monthly cover features; and reported on everything from the relationship between Formula One and fashion to the top trends from fashion month, season after season. Eliza lives on the Upper West Side and spends her free time researching F1 fashion imagery for her side Instagram accounts @thepinnacleoffashion and @f1paddockfits, running in Central Park, and scouring The RealReal for discounted Prada.
html:
I can't be the only person whose father insists they max out their 401(k) every single time you speak with them. I swear it's the first thing he brings up during our weekly catch-ups. Usually, I'm happy to oblige, but after my morning new-arrivals scroll, I'm not convinced it's the best use of my finances—at least, not this month. Instead, I'd rather invest in my wardrobe, specifically with the 30 finds I just discovered at COS, Mango, and H&M. Sure, I might be a little bit less prepared for retirement in a decade, but I'll have a rich-looking wardrobe, and right now, that's priority number one.

Ahead, discover the 10 pieces from each of the aforementioned retailers that look far more expensive than they are. None cost more than $250, and the only ones that reach that limit are cashmere aka the material most worth splurging on. Before they dare to sell out, scroll down to start picking out your favorites. Trust me. They'll be worth giving up this month's 401(k) allocation for, even if it means getting that disappointed dad look over FaceTime.

H&M

Tie-Belt Twill Jacket

This belted jacket might cost $60, but everyone will estimate its value to be $600+.

Chocolate-brown trousers? Say less.

I'm honestly shocked that these haven't sold out yet.

H&M

Twill Jacket With Belt

H&M

Blue Light Eyeglasses

No one has to know these aren't prescription.

No, you don't need to spend hundreds of dollars to get a suede jacket that looks luxurious.

H&M

Twill Jacket With Collar

H&M

Knee-High Biker Boots

These moto boots were calling my name, but I'm not sure my dad will accept this as an excuse.

Mango

MANGO

Jacket With Mandarin Collar and Jewel Buttons

The only word that comes to mind is wow.

MANGO

Matilda Medium-Rise Straight-Fit Jeans

Mango's jeans are slept on far too often.

MANGO

Kitten Shoe With Round Toe

These are so elegant. Count me as a fan.

MANGO

Contrasting Satin Dress

The sheer layer makes this dress feel far more formal and rich than a standard slip.

MANGO

Oversized Parka With Zipper

"Need" is a strong word, but it's the only one appropriate when this anorak is the subject in question.

MANGO

Short Knit Table Dress

Of course, I need this drop-waist minidress to wear underneath the above anorak.

MANGO

Open-Toe Leather Shoes

MANGO

Chunky-Knit Sweater With Ribbed Trims

I know, I know—I own a lot of sweaters, but this one is different than all of those.

MANGO

High Neck Midi Wool Coat

Dress for the tax bracket you want to be in, starting with this seriously pricey-looking coat.

MANGO

Double-Handle Bowling Bag

As if anyone needed an excuse to buy this east-west bowling bag, it just went on sale.

COS

COS

Oversized Tailored Shirt

I can just imagine wearing this pastel shirt with a bikini in Sicily.

COS

Square-Toe Leather Court Shoes

My wallet hates to see a cute pair of in-stock court shoes coming.

COS

Cavatelli Phone Pouch in Leather

This little red purse is too cute to not purchase.

COS

Column Straight-Leg Jeans

I might not need another pair of straight-leg jeans, but I want them, and that's enough for me today.

COS

Fine Pure Cashmere Cardigan

Great cashmere is never a bad investment.

COS

Molten Pendant Necklace

World, meet the necklace set to make every one of my boring outfits chic.

COS

Boiled-Wool Midi Dress

I'm in love with the neckline on this wool dress.

COS

Minimal Suede Trainers

The red version of these already sold out. Don't let this gorgeous brown option follow suit.

COS

Pure Cashmere Sweater

BRB, I'm busy buying cashmere.

COS

Boiled Merino Wool Pants

To go with my new fancy cashmere sweater, naturally.

Eliza Huber is a New York-based senior fashion editor who specializes in trend reporting, brand discovery, and the intersection of sports and fashion. She joined Who What Wear in 2021 after almost four years on the fashion team at Refinery29, the job she took after graduating with a marketing degree from the University of Iowa. She has since launched two monthly columns, Let's Get a Room and Ways to Wear; profiled the likes of Dakota Fanning, Diane Kruger, Katie Holmes, Gracie Abrams, and Sabrina Carpenter for WWW's monthly cover features; and reported on everything from the relationship between Formula One and fashion to the top trends from fashion month, season after season. Eliza lives on the Upper West Side and spends her free time researching F1 fashion imagery for her side Instagram accounts @thepinnacleoffashion and @f1paddockfits, running in Central Park, and scouring The RealReal for discounted Prada.
